headline: Kale, Quinoa, and Avocado Salad with Lemon Dijon Vinaigrette
description: Tender steamed kale, quinoa, bell pepper, cucumber, onion, and avocado are tossed with a homemade vinaigrette in this super salad.

video.description: Loaded with super food, there’s so much good stuff in this healthy salad.
video.name: Kale, Quinoa, & Avocado Salad with Dijon Vinaigrette

name: Kale, Quinoa, and Avocado Salad with Lemon Dijon Vinaigrette
recipeIngredient: 1 bunch kale, torn into bite-sized pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the quinoa and 1 1/3 cup water to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the quinoa is tender, and the water has been absorbed, about 15 to 20 minutes. Set aside to cool.

Place kale in a steamer basket over 1 inch of boiling water in a saucepan. Cover saucepan with a lid and steam kale until hot, about 45 seconds; transfer to a large plate. Top kale with quinoa, avocado, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, and feta cheese.
Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, sea salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until the oil emulsifies into the dressing; pour over the salad.

review.reviewBody: I added fresh jalapeno finely chopped and Grape tomatoes cut in quarters. I omitted the red bell pepper.
This salad is SOOOO yummy. I didn't think I'd like it because of the quinoa but it's so tasty and holds up in the fridge!
Absolutely loved it!
This is a great recipe! I removed the bell peppers and used low-fat Balsamic Vignagrette salad dressing. Yummy!

I love this salad and so does everyone else who has tasted it. We were going to have friends over and they wanted to delay due to the need to eat healthy. I said I have some delicious healthy recipes. Usually I serve this with salmon steaks but tonight I served it with baked yams. For four of us I doubled the recipe and had a little left over. I also really enjoy a balsamic glaze drizzled over this! It's delicious on its own but the balsamic glaze kicks it up a notch! In the attached photo, I had not yet added the feta cheese. . . That's important! ;-)
Yum! I use some homemade fermented or pickled red onions in place of fresh cut and throw in diced chicken, ham or egg for some added protein.
I keep going back to this one, it's so good!!

Stephanie you went over and beyond delicious. I’m always trying to find healthy recipes (without sacrificing taste) for my fitness group I teach. This was a hit. Thank you, next time I have to double the recipe. I usually make healthy dishes once a month as a little treat after class and serve them in the teeny, tiny tasting bowls, but this time, they looked at me like I was crazy...so it was requested for our next treat as a full lunch. Isn’t that some nerve??.
I had this as late lunch, since am trying to loose weight and my daughter loved it. I omitted the cheese and was still delicious

I don't normally post reviews about many recipes on here although I use All Recipes all the time. This salad though..... wow! Even my hubby who is a self described kale hater loved this salad. I didn't change anything about the salad. For us it was perfect and it will be transferred (with credits of course) to my Grandma's Recipe box.
This was so delicious. I added leftover salmon.
Delicious and healthy. Next time I will double the amount of dressing just because I liked the flavor of it so much.
I now have a new delicious salad..I replaced the dijon mustard with stone ground mustard and added maple syrup and apple cider vinegar to the vinaigrette
Delicious and healthy! Will add to my regular rotation, without any changes.
Loved this dish. I don’t care for kale so substituted spinach. Also added toasted walnuts to give it a little more crunch. Will Definitely make again
Wow! Loaded with flavor! We substituted spinach for the kale, but other than that we stuck with the recipe. At it with Arabic pita and it was a great, healthy and not too heavy dinner!
Made as described and it was delicious. Next time will experiment with adding different veggies and spice to the dressing.

This was an easy and great salad to make on a hot summer night. I've made this last Sunday night and also made it tonight with leftover ingredients. I didn't really change much to the recipe. Instead of peeling the avocado, I just split in half and chopped the insides. And since I didn't have red onion tonight, I skipped it. It's really fulling and tastes real good.
Delicious and easy to put together.
Amazing! Followed this recipe almost exactly, except I added a tablespoon or two of honey to the dressing. The flavors are so complex and go so well together! Highly recommend!

SO good! I love the different textures. The flavors in this salad go so well together. I used a whole avocado since I really like them. Takes a little extra time for a salad since you have to boil the quinoa so get your ingredients and dressing ready while you wait. This recipe is definitely a keeper!
Delicious and easy!

This was absolutely fantastic! I added some chopped cherry tomatoes to the salad and also a clove of crushed garlic to the salad dressing for some extra zing. This could easily be a very filling meal on its own or with the addition of some lean protein. I most definitely will be making this again!

This is so good I didn't even wait for it to chill!! I followed the recipe except that my kale was bad to I used baby spinach instead. I tossed some cherry tomatoes on top, also. I doubled the recipe and am very glad I did. This stuff is the bomb!
LOVE IT

I did add more vegetables since there were hardly any in there. I added some carrot, more red pepper and onion (which I didn't really need to do), and sliced grape tomatoes. I also used 1 cup of quinoa instead of 2/3 cup. I think next time I will wilt the kale a little longer then 45 seconds as mine was still a little bitter. My husband put some olives in his and also some dried cherries since he said it needed something.
Boy was the dressing tart! I tasted it once it was done and after reading some of the reviews I put in about 2 Tbl. of honey, can't remember exactly. It was much better so for these changes I give it 4 stars but without changing the dressing I would have given it 3.
The salad was delicious I used shaved Parmesan instead of feta cheese and added 1/2of red barley pear

This salad was surprisingly good! Don't judge the dressing until it's on the salad. I sampled it and wasn't pleased but when you put it together with the ingredients of the salad, it was spectacular. this will definitely be part of my regular menu now. Thank you!
I love this recipe! I love the addition of feta cheese for texture.
Tasty but simple salad. I didn’t add cheese because I’d cholesterol restrictions and it still tasted good. This will make a nice summer meal with some crusty bread on the side.

I made this to the T. My husband believe it or not is a salad fan, and he loved this one. He has been going on and on about the salad dressing. I made a lot more of everything when I was chopping, so that we would have extra for lunches. I would double the salad dressing next time just to have extra home made dressing in the fridge to use later. I did chop and roast a small sweet potato to go with this. It was just a little more added bliss. Thanks so much for a great recipe we will use again and again!!

I made this to the T. My husband believe it or not is a salad fan, and he loved this one. He has been going on and on about the salad dressing. I made a lot more of everything when I was chopping, so that we would have extra for lunches. I would double the salad dressing next time just to have extra home made dressing in the fridge to use later. I did chop and roast a small sweet potato to go with this. It was just a little more added bliss. Thanks so much for a great recipe we will use again and again!!
Not a fan of the dressing.
One of our family’s absolute favorites!

I don't have a steamer so I stirfried the kale in a bit of chicken broth, with a lid on, and followed the rest of the recipe exactly. It was simply delicious!!!! Definitely would make this one again... 

Two years later, I have yet to meet anyone who did not love this salad once they got past their aversion to trying quinoa. I arrange the ingredients in layers on a roast platter, then evenly distribute the dressing... Never have leftovers! (-:
Everyone I’ve made this for loves it! Myself included!
Delicious. Second time I pan fried some garlic and then added the kale for a bit of flavor.
Love this Recipe!!! So delicious and fresh!
It was okay. Hubby didn’t like the quinoa.
The dressing on this salad is very good. I even add a little extra dijon mustard. Also more cucumber for the crunch.
This is amazing. Only thing I do differently is adding shredded chicken!
This was a big hit. I served it to 17 people and there was not one bite left over.

This was really good! Followed recipe exactly, measured everything! Ended up making 1.5 of dressing as worried it wasn’t enough, but did not even end up using it all. Did however use minute ready quinoa- just opened and added.
I didn't steam the kale and I loved it. Will certainly make it again as it was a hit with the guests.

I made it just as directed, except I added some cooked chicken. It was super good! 
I brought it to a potluck and even those afraid of kale went back for seconds!

Excellent flavour - rave reviews
Had to lower the amount of kale - perhaps a "bunch" of kale is larger in Canada.
It was nice and tasty. I found the dressing a little to mustardy. Would be good with an orangy type dressing too.

I substituted Farro for quinoa. Massaged kale w salt ahead of time. Added cherry tomatoes and added entire avocado just before serving. Served to guests and ate leftover 4 days later (stored in Mason jar). Still yummy.
Really light, fresh, easy and satisfying. I topped it with baked cod and drizzled the dressing over all of it. A big hit with my family. I’ll definitely make it again.

I added tomatoes, mushrooms and broccoli to the salad. I also made a bigger portion to feed more people, everyone agreed the dressing was the key to making the salad great. (Side note didnt have a strainer to steam my kale so I used a crock pot and aluminum foil that u poked holes in)
I took the advice of another and micro the damp kale for 30 seconds, GREAT IDEA!. I'm not a fan of raw peppers so I added roasted red pepper strips. It was Delicious! It will be a keeper.

I've made this a few times now and it's a hit at our house. I don't steam the kale. Instead I squeeze it a whole bunch and then put the hot quinoa right on top of it. Other than that I follow the recipe as it is. It is delicious!
I added garden fresh cherry tomatoes to mine. It's very crispy, delicious and nutrient packed!! I will definitely make it again!
Delicious! I made it twice in one week!
I have to admit I didn’t use kale. I did use a spring mix with spinach and arugula. It was delicious. The salad dressing is my go to recipe now! Love it!
Thanks for the recipe! It tastes great!
Excellent, easy and filling. I will definitely make this again!
husband loved it I will make this again
Delicious!!

I made this for Easter and everyone loved it! I added finely chopped radishes and apples. I also added craisins and raw pumpkin seeds. I did not steam the kale at all. I just cut it in tiny pieces with kitchen shears. Due to time, I made dressing with a Good Seasons packet and added a little honey and lime juice. Delish!!

I’m working on building a plant based diet with foods that are as unprocessed as possible, but easy to prepare. This is a surprisingly tasty recipe. It’s filling and versatile, accommodating a variety of grains and veggies. I make it ahead on Sunday and have lunch ready to go the next morning.
Thank you for a great new addition to my recipe box!
No changes and I will make it again. Great dish.
Delicious recipe! I love the Dijon mustard. Adding tomatoes and garlic is good too!
Absolutely wonderful taste and smelled so iñviting. Easy to make. Light salad addition to a meal of barbequed ribs añd baked beans. Looking forward to making again.
I absolutely Love It!
Is good
Super! I added other veg as well because, why not! Cherry tomatoes and carrots.

Great! ! My daughter loved it. Great salad, easy to make, I used baby kale as that's what I had on hand. I didn't bother steaming it, it softened when I blended the warm quinoa into it. Im hoping it is as delicious the next day.

This salad is friggin amazing. I'm eating it right now actually...You don't have to make ANY changes and its wonderful, but I added some cherry tomatoes cause I had them and some slivered almonds, just because I like those in a salad, but dang! SO GOOD! The dressing is perfect, even the KALE tastes good, which is saying something, hahaha. great job on this recipe!
Was never a big fan of kale until now!! My kids (5,3 &2) LOVED it. Healthy and great as a lunch or a side!
Added extra avocado
Delicious!!!! My family prefers the taste of sauteed veggies, and so sauteed the peppers and also added carrots. It was wonderful- a big hit!
Very good. I don't usually like kale, but this was good.

Love this salad and make it as a side dish often. It pairs well with fish (grilled tuna anyone?) I sometimes enhance the recipe by adding extra vegetables including sugar snap peas, red bell pepper . The vinaigrette just gets better as it melds together. A healthy and tasty dish even for those that don't like kale!

The dressing really makes this salad! 
The rest is up for interpretation. I accidentally ate the avocado waiting for the quinoa to cook. Threw in some pumpkin seeds, slivered carrots, and celery.

This was delicious! I made it last night for the first time for a dinner party and everyone loved it. Not only did it look great (this website won't let me upload my photo) but it tasted great - and tasted even better today. I didn't have Dijon so make it without that and it still was good.

Wow! This quinoa salad recipe looks so tasty and healthy that I must try it. But, I am going to replace kale with green and red spinach because they are local produce. I am Indian, so I love the kick of dijon but may give add a dash of roasted garam masala on top.
We loved this, the only thing I did differently is use veggie broth instead of water to cook the quinoa
We loved this, the only thing I did differently is use veggie broth instead of water to cook the quinoa

I usually make a recipe I find on here that looks delicious and it ends up alright and not how I expected it to taste. . This one was incredible and was beyond my expectations. I was nervous when I taste tested the dressing by itself, but once everything is mixed in together it is amazing. The dressing may seem salty, but I promise it balances out once mixed in with everything. Don't leave a single step out! I don't think I have ever left a review on Allrecipes and it is my favorite site. This was review-worthy. It is so easy to make too! I added more cucumbers, avocado and bell pepper. I also used tri color quinoa because it's all I had on hand but I doubt that made any difference whatsoever besides add contrast to the presentation. Delicious!!!
I was worried because I never had kale before but It was delicious, and I didn't change anything in the recipe.
Yummy! I didn't have feta (which would have made it BETTER) so I used some mozzarella. I also can't eat peppers so I doubled the cucumber and added some dried cranberry for color. Delish!

This is a delicious alternative to your everyday side dish. My guest ate multiple helpings . I followed the recipe fairly closely, but used the entire avocado. I am very fond of feta cheese, so I also added more feta. I will definitely make this again.

It was great. As my husband is on a low carb diet, I used corn instead of quinoa and stirred it into the veggies. I didn't have purple onion and used green onions. The steamed kale was a delicious discovery. I liked it not being tough and the bright green bed was lovely.

Made recipe as written except my pepper was green that I used. I really liked the way everything came together except for the dressing.....just not to my liking, for me there was too much Dijon. I will definitely make again, however; I will do my own oil/lemon dressing or oil/vinegar dressing. Another option I will try is an Asian flavoured dressing. But all in all a great healthy meal! Thank you Stephanie.

One of our favorites! Very healthy and very good! For the first time this summer, we made it almost as a tossed salad, adding all of the ingredients into a bowl and tossing together (after the kale had cooled) instead of layering the kale then the quinoa. We served it to a larger crowd and everyone liked it-young and old.
This was awesome! Super great combination of flavors. Fresh-tasting and not bitter at all. A hit with all types of folks!
I loved this salad. The only thing I changed was the kale. I bought baby kale and didn’t have to do any to it. Will definitely make it again. Very refreshing for the summer months.
I did not have kale. However, it was divine! I added garbanzo beans for more protein. I am making it again tonight.
Used fresh baby spinach instead of kale. Yummy dinner. We loved it!
Double avocado!
I changed the olive oil to avocado oil. The olive oil had to much of an over powering flavour. I would make it again
Turned out great. Everyone loved it. Did not change anything .

Love this healthy recipe—thanks for sharing. My only “tweaks”: I substituted green onion for the red onion because it’s hard to get good red onions where I live...and I finely chopped the kale and all the veggies and mixed everything together. The Dijon, feta and lemon juice in this recipe give the salad just the right amount of flavorful zestiness.
Made this several times and we love it.
My family loved this recipe! The dressing is amazing.
I loved this recipe. Very balanced flavour. And what's most important, it is really healthy and light for your stomach.
I omitted the avocado and added chopped tomato. Instead of mustard I added cilantro. This turned out delicious!
Had to substitute a couple ingredients due to poor planning but even the kale tasted good and I normally don't like kale. Maybe I know to steam kale now.

item.name: Kale, Quinoa, and Avocado Salad with Lemon Dijon Vinaigrette
